intro: Senecio repangae, commonly known as the East African groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassland habitats, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, with a slightly hairy surface, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Senecio repangae is often found in montane environments, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
